page.title: 15FOOD IN BUCKLAND BREWER
page.content: {TRADITIONAL LOCAL FOODS} MANY OF THE TRADITIONAL DISHES OF THE AREA APPEAR TO HAVE SO DECLINED IN POPULARITY THAT THEY DID NOT FEATURE IN THE SURVEY OF FOODS EATEN. A RANGE OF PIES AND PASTIES CONTAINING FILLINGS SUCH AS{EGG AND PARSLEY}OR {EGG AND LEEK ;JUNKETS,}MADE FROM MILK AND RENNET, AND{CUTROUNDS,}A FORM OF BREAD ROLL, HAD ALL DISAPPEARED FROM THE LIST OF FOODS EATEN BY ABOUT FORTY LOCAL FAMILIES DURING ONE WEEK. MEAT AND VEGETABLE{PASTIES}HAD BEEN EATEN BY 16 PERCENT OF THE FAMILIES SURVEYED, IN EQUAL PROPORTIONS OF HOME-MADE AND BOUGHT VARIETIES. DEVON {CLOTTED CREAM}WAS EATEN BY ONLY 8 PER CENT OF THOSE SURVEYED. BY CONTRAST A NUMBER OF{FOREIGN FOODS, INCLUDING{PIZZA, SPAGHETTI {BOLOGNAISE, PAELLA, MUESLI, QUICHE}AND {CROISSANTS}WERE RECORDED.
